thread.title: Tom Brady not satisfied: 'We've got to play better' | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
thread.title_full: Tom Brady not satisfied: 'We've got to play better' | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian | Boston Herald

author: Adam Kurkjian
title: Tom Brady not satisfied: 'We've got to play better' | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
text:
Although the Patriots had a pretty complete and decisive victory in today's 30-6 dominance of the Cowboys, Tom Brady sees room for improvement.
Brady was sacked five times in the first half, the first time that's happened since 2001.
"They have some good personnel on defense," Brady said. "We've got to play better."
Brady did not suffer a sack in the second half and finished 20-of-27 for 275 yards and two touchdowns. He also snuck for another one from a yard out.
Brady said the Cowboys have a "good front" with "good team speed," and blamed the sacks on himself, saying he was "probably holding it too long."
As for the unexpected defensive alignment that Bill Belichick referred to moments earlier, Brady said, "Can't practice everything. We'll make the adjustments and hopefully be better next week."
Like Belichick, he praised running back Dion Lewis, but cautioned that the team has only played four games.
"He's made a huge impact on our team," Brady said. "He's just been an amazing player ... but it's still a long season."
Brady kept his comments short after his team moved to 4-0 with a rematch of last season's AFC title game looming next Sunday night in Indianapolis.
"I'm glad we got the win," he said.
